title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 347.21 - Allocation of statewide goal by commissioner
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 347.21 - Allocation of statewide goal by commissioner

State Regulations

For each State fiscal year for which a statewide child
support collection goal has been established, the commissioner shall, subject
to the approval of the director of the budget, allocate a portion of the
statewide goal to each social services district. Each district's support goal
shall be a function of that district's percentage of the statewide aid to
dependent children caseload based on a methodology which will be applied
uniformly to all districts. Upon allocation, the department shall notify each
social services district of its portion of the statewide
goal. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
347.21

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
